alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:59AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Itasca, southern St. Louis, northeastern Carlton, southwestern Lake and northwestern Douglas Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 159 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Togo, to 10 miles west of Whiteface Reservoir, to near Oliver, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oliver around 205 AM CDT. Proctor around 210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Superior, Whiteface Reservoir and Wisconsin Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
